message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CY

This paper belongs to the field of natural language processing (NLP) and specifically focuses on named entity recognition (NER) in mixed lingual Indian text. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which encompasses research on NLP and related areas. 

The paper also involves the use of machine learning algorithms for evaluation, which suggests that it could also fit under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Learning). 

Additionally, the use of Wikipedia as a source for the corpus suggests that it could fall under cs.IR (Information Retrieval), as the paper involves the retrieval and processing of text data from a large online source. 

Finally, the paper's focus on mixed lingual text and the use of Hindi and English languages suggests that it could also fit under cs.CY (Computational Linguistics), which deals with the intersection of linguistics and computer science.
